title: Part (a)(i)
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value 1) to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and 2) to score the response.

The response describes, not just identifies, one potential benefit for the proposed project.
descriptions: The response does not describe one of the following benefits.
The response describes one of the following benefits.

title: Part (a)(ii)
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value 1) to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and 2) to score the response.

The response describes, not just identifies, one potential negative consequence for the proposed project.
descriptions: The response does not describe a negative consequence of the proposed project.
The response describes a negative consequence of the proposed project.

title: Part (b)(i)
stimulusHtml: Select a point value 1) to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and 2) to score the response
descriptions: The response does not propose a solution to slow the population growth rate in the country, such as:
The response proposes a solution to slow the population growth rate in the country, such as:

title: Part (b)(ii)
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value 1) to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and 2) to score the response.

The response must explain, not just identify, how the proposed solution could address the concern over the amount of arable land.
descriptions: The response does not explain that slowing population growth would address the concerns over having enough arable land to feed the population. The response must address that a rapidly growing population will need to have land for habitat and that the population will likely expand onto arable land. If population growth rates are reduced, the population will not need to build on as much arable land.

The response explains that slowing population growth would address the concerns over having enough arable land to feed the population. The response must address that a rapidly growing population will need to have land for habitat and that the population will likely expand onto arable land. If population growth rates are reduced, the population will not need to build on as much arable land.

title: Part (c)(i)
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value 1) to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and 2) to score the response.

The students must show their work for full credit. Students do not need to include units in the setup.
descriptions: The response does not show the correct setup and does not have the correct final calculation.
The response does not show the correct setup or does not have the correct final calculation.
The response shows the correct setup and has the correct final calculation.

title: Part (c)(ii)
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value 1) to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and 2) to score the response.

The students must show their work for full credit. Students do not need to include units in the setup.

If the student uses the value calculated in (c)(i) that is incorrect, but they use the value in the equation below correctly, both points can be earned for part (c)(ii).
descriptions: The response does not show the correct setup and does not have the correct final calculation.
The response does not show the correct setup or does not have the correct final calculation.
The response shows the correct setup and has the correct final calculation.
